Job Title: Revenue Specialist

Location: Nashville Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Administrative, Customer Service

Description:
About the Company:OMNIA Partners has become the largest and most experienced purchasing organization for public and private sector markets by delivering unparalleled scale and solutions. Through further organic growth and strategic acquisitions, OMNIA Partners will continue to drive economies of scale to execute more contracts, in more verticals, with transparent, value-driven pricing for our membership of companies. Our success and growth have been unparalleled in this space.
At the core of our success is a high energy, talented staff with diverse skills and a unified focus on delivering value and an emphasis on creativity, strategic thinking, and execution
Job Title: Revenue SpecialistLocation: Franklin, TN
Job Description:We are currently seeking a Revenue Specialist responsible for the daily accounts payable processing function, including processing invoices for payment, matching invoices to purchase orders, resolving discrepancies, processing payments via Automated Clearing House (ACH) and checks, reconciling weekly check runs, communicating with vendors as needed, and creating and maintaining accurate payables records. Other responsibilities include verifying purchasing procedures such as accounting code reviews, signatory guidelines, and purchase order accuracy. The position is a full-time in-office position in our Franklin, TN headquarters and office hours are generally 8 am – 5 pm.  Summary of Responsibilities:Process individual accounts payable invoices, including reviews general ledger coding for accuracy.Verify purchasing procedures such as signatory guidelines, matching and purchase order accuracy.Process accounts payable payments via ACH and checks.Process check voids in Accounts Payable system.Bookkeeping entries in accounting software including accounts payableTrack revenues by verifying and entering transactionsMaintain precise records of all incoming paymentsReconcile any irregularities in receiptsContinuous evaluation of current policies and recommendations for process improvementsTimely and accurate processing of vendor invoices and credit card expendituresMaintaining records and important files (e.g., downloading bank statements, copies of checks, invoices, documentation, reports, etc.) to ensure the availability and accessibility of documentation and third-party reports.Answering questions from vendors and clientsProcessing electronic bill paymentsMaintaining vendor filesMaintaining W-9s and preparing 1099sReconciling vendor statements, including researching and correcting discrepanciesAssisting in month-end closingMaintaining files and documentation thoroughly and accurately, in accordance with company policy and accepted accounting practicesAssist with coordination of audits and exams.Additional duties may be assigned as needed.  Qualifications:Bachelor’s in Accounting, Finance or related field preferred.Proficient in computer applications such as Microsoft Office and Excel.Sage Intacct or similar accounting software experience preferred.Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced, professional environment.Strong customer service skills.Accuracy and efficiency in data entry required.Ability to calculate and manage accounting figures.Basic understanding of accounting principles.Strong organizational skills with attention to detail, ability to prioritize tasks.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
